  • Sampler3D

Class Sampler3D

Regular sampling in 3D. By default the 3 axis are unknown

example
const meca = require("@youwol/mechanics")

class Algo {
    constructor() {
        this.a_ = 0
        this.b_ = 0
        this.c_ = 0
    }

    set a(v) {this.a_ = v}
    get a()  {return this.a_}

    set b(v) {this.b_ = v}
    get b()  {return this.b_}

    set c(v) {this.c_ = v}
    get c()  {return this.c_}

    run() {
        console.log(this.a_, this.b_, this.c_)
    }
}

const algo = new Algo()

const sampler = new meca.Sampler3D()
sampler.configure(algo, 'x', 'a', {n: 10, min: 0, max: 1})
sampler.configure(algo, 'y', 'b', {n: 10, min: 0, max: 1})
sampler.configure(algo, 'z', 'c', {n: 10, min: 0, max: 1})

sampler.forEach( p => {
    algo.run()
})

Accessors

finishedYAxisCallBack

  • set finishedYAxisCallBack(cb: Function): void

  • Called every time the y-axis is done to iterate

    Parameters

    • cb: Function

    Returns void

finishedZAxisCallBack

  • set finishedZAxisCallBack(cb: Function): void

  • Called every time the y-axis is done to iterate

    Parameters

    • cb: Function

    Returns void

Methods

checkAxis

  • checkAxis(): void

  • Returns void

configure

  • configure(parent: any, axeName: string, property: string, params?: { max?: number; min?: number; n?: number; reverse?: boolean }): boolean

  • Configure the axis 'x', 'y' or 'z' to be defined as a member variable given by its name (property)

    example

    configure(sampler, 'x', 'cohesion', {n:10, min:0, max:1, reverse:false})

    Parameters

    • parent: any

      The object supporting the property (e.g., object['pressure'], where object is the parent and pressure is the property)

    • axeName: string

      Either 'x', 'y' or 'z'

    • property: string

      The property name of this derived class

    • params: { max?: number; min?: number; n?: number; reverse?: boolean } = {}
      • Optional max?: number
      • Optional min?: number
      • Optional n?: number
      • Optional reverse?: boolean

    Returns boolean

forEach

  • forEach(cb: Function): void

  • The order of iteration is

    for (x) {
         for (y) {
             for (z) {
                 ...
                 endZAxisCallback()
             }
             endYAxisCallback()
         }
    }
    example
    this.forEach( (p: [number, number,  number]) => {
       const value = this.compute(p) // for example
    })

    Parameters

    • cb: Function

      a function callback

    Returns void
